citation.article-title: Cohnella thermotolerans gen. nov., sp. nov., and classification of 'Paenibacillus hongkongensis' as Cohnella hongkongensis sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Cohnella (Coh.nel′la. N.L. fem. dim. n. Cohnella named after Ferdinand Cohn, the German microbiologist who first described the bacterial genus Bacillus in 1872).
Cells are Gram-positive, spore-forming, aerobic, non-motile, rod-shaped and thermotolerant.
Good growth occurs after 24 h incubation on TS and nutrient agars at 25–30 °C; good growth also occurs at 55 °C.
Predominant polar lipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidyglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine and lysyl-phosphatidylglycerol.
In addition, two unknown phospholipids and four unknown aminophospholipids are present.
The major fatty acids are iso C16 : 0, anteiso C15 : 0 and C16 : 0.
The type species is Cohnella thermotolerans.
